alert.note: Alert for Bullitt; Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL CLARK...EASTERN FLOYD...CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND NORTH CENTRAL BULLITT COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Albany, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisville, Jeffersonville, New Albany, Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Shively, Windy Hills, Pioneer Village, Hurstbourne Acres and Audubon Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
